metadata.title: CVE-2014-0240 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The mod_wsgi module before 3.5 for Apache, when daemon mode is enabled,does not properly handle error codes returned by setuid when run on certainLinux kernels, which allows local users to gain privileges via vectorsrelated to the number of running processes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-wsgi - 3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1
libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 - 3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mod-wsgi package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-4ubuntu2.1.14.04.1').
